header.rec_loc: The recording was made in the CICIC Artâ€™s Centre in Taunton Somerset
header.topics: Art course running at the time, plus old issues concerning old college.
header.activity: Talking about opportunities for art in Taunton.

speaker.dialect_rep: I may have a slight Somerset accent
speaker.occupation: retired artist and antique dealer/gallery owner

body.u: hi thank you for talking to me today erm so can you tell me about the art course you're running here?

yes this is a a recreational course at the Creative Innovation Centre so the creative the word creative innovation is key to the sort of course we do here it's not the normal erm sort of for instance watercolour for beginners type course so a lot of the erm the people who attend are the majority of them are mature people and quite a few have experienced a reasonably good or very er professional art education but it's open to erm anyone really and we have about twenty doing painting and drawing in the morning and about twenty doing the life drawing and the nearest you could say was related to would be a foundation type course
in an art school so it's quite diagnostic in a sense

but it's very erm liberally individually biased er in the sense that people are encouraged to sort of work in a way that suits them and I suppose my philosophy would be that they'll learn more from each other than they would from me
cos cos they work they're encouraged to experiment really
right okay so what sort of qualification do they get afterwards is it in line with an art access course or anything?
no there is no qualification as such
so it's not it's not a ratified recognisable
erm educational qualification it it is purely recreational
but it's also seen as part of the sort of a wider remit here where we do all sorts of music and poetry and languages and performance
and we've got a new cinema
well sorry not a new cinema
so what sort of things are they showing then?
er some very popular films like erm oh Citizen Kane
we've been showing and Lawrence of Arabia we've done The Bicycle Thieves
so iit depends and we haven't got a it's not like a sort of London classic cinema where it's all sort of Italian Swedish French it's
quite a healthy mix but the the the the art on the Friday is seen as just an integral part of the whole centre really
right great erm and hahave you seen that wonderful new film er Lady in the Van with?
but I know a lot about the Lady ii
because yeah I've been following that for years
yeah but I'm looking forward to it and I will be seeing it
and I I I erm I found it incredibly sad

although I could see that there was a bit of humour in it but it was incredibly poignant and it left me feel you know with a a feeling of erm she'd been on the run all her life basically and that's what that's what the feeling it left me with erm so erm they do a lot of films down at the Odeon aand do they do any ballet dancing films or any of that sort of thing here? any dance?
not as such yet I'm not er but it's it's can I ask something?
is it it's linked with what?
you're on a sort of rotation thing?
yeah but I'm so I can see the films becoming
well it could you could run two or three
I would think the nearest equivalent I can think of is
now has has got a very very good film erm facility there
yeah what's the name of that French comedian was it Petit?
Tati Tati I'd love to see some Jacques Tati films
oh oh well I have got
well this is not the answer you want but I can bring I can bring you some of mine and you can take them home
oh oh wow I'd love that
yeah well mishmish well I'll I'll I'll drop some around or I'll
because when we were at erm college I took one out of the library once
and and I watched it and we just thought it was the best one of the best things we'd ever seen
it just sort of appealed to us
yeah I've got sort of got a few I can
I'll drop them I'll bring them up or
yeah why don't you come over one evening and
yeah iif you I mean if you're going home one evening you could have erm an evening meal with us if you wanted to
that would be lovely that's very
it is very kind of you
listens to it are you there ? listens to these so
it'll be alright yeah so yeah no come on and erm II've been on erm I've got this autoimmune thing and I've had to to change my whole eating habits at the moment
and erm I've lost half a stone in erm in in six weeks erm and I but because because I've had to give up I lo I lost lost weight at Christmas
because I've got to give up all these things
but that's not too good for you because you weren't overweight
I mean most women would be
you know they'd like to to lose but
you don't really need to lose weight
well I was nine stone four and I've gone down to
eight and a half so but that's
only because I'm not eating what I used to eat which was I used to like a piece of cake you know
and like you know like some sweet things but I haven't had anything sweet
that's all it is it's not it's not sinister it's just the fact that I'm have had to give up yeast and if you have to give up yeast you have to give up sugar cos of the
so there you go so that that's erm that's the situation so you're keeping fit though aren't you? you look very fit
well as you can see I'm seventy-one so I can't complain
but I I I I try I've always not tried cos I do keep my mind active and I
and I and I walk and do things I cannot live a sedentary life so I'm really
mind and body keep them going and ticking over
exactly keep them going and what about erm er are you still going abroad to in the summer? I think you used to go abroad in the summer was it Africa you used to go?
II've I used to go everywhere but II've been going to Jamaica a lot
on on on a on these yoga retreats really
but I don't teach the yoga but erm
and I go to France a lot and I've just come back from Amsterdam
no I w no I I went over for there's this huge big student competition now
for painters under twenty-five art students
and it takes place at the
which is a big student hostel
and we've been taking students there for years I've I took I've taken them there from various art schools
and it's a wonderful competition where they come from well university was there this year and
various other places and erm it's painters and you just choose the one you think is the best
and you go around and you put your erm your selection in a box and then you have this extraordinary evening where all the drinks and all this extraordinary food is free for about ffour hours
oh champagne and and oysters and salmon and and then the one who gets the most votes wins
for the well if we'd have still been erm around
the problem with they were generally more mature students as you recall
yes that's right no it wouldn't have worked
you can always find a few under twenty-five
not that many have you been to the new building down there? they said they opened it recently
I haven't but it's absolutely I've heard things like it's so sanitised and clinical it almost
looks like a they're gonna perperform operations in it
or it's a cross between that and some sort of government
social security building but it was empty
oh right nothing in it at all?
well I don't know I don't know what's happened there
I know loads of the courses have gone
and as you know fine art was closed
yeah well I'm not surprised she erm
she said she didn't like the staff she didn't
she didn't like the staff and she didn't like the students
in this envi area that there's no fine art education
well you remember when I took her to task about it all?
I went I I went a bit berserk and I got involved

and she said it was none of his business aand I confronted her and I said well he he is the MP you know it might be some of his business cos he was voted in which is more than she was I mean she wasn't voted in she just happened to get the position
he's not he's not doing it any more now
I'm recording sorry it won't take much longer
another five minutes erm we're nearly finished erm so
it was a Tory stronghold for years and years and years
the sort of ssitting MP and it was almost like it was his personal fiefdom
I think he was chairman of the Nineteen Twenty-Two Committee
yeah have you ever heard him speak?
that would be when I was younger I think he's probably
well he talked about they were closing the maternity home in
and we I went with some friends of mine who had lots of children and had used the maternity home and I went with them to hear him speak and he was absolutely brilliant
he really was so erm yeah
well he he was quite yeah I think he was quite a sort of one-nation Tory
he really knew how to to give a good speech but then at his age then even then he would have had a lot of experience and to be
a good speaker you need to have a lot of experience
erm you know? is a very good speaker so he always gets invited to speak to people
yeah he's a very good speaker
well yeah absolutely yeah I mean he well when you've been doing the same sort like yourself when you've been doing the same subject for years and years
you know erm and you're sort of top of your tree in your whatever it is he's erm we've got about another five minutes to go so I don't know whether you want to say anything?
only about spspeaking if we're just talking there
I could speak quite relaxed and and no problem at a hundred students
a hundred and fifty and I've done that often
I always hated formal speaking though
sort of like the BA presentation type speech
and I really really hated it
to the point that I could almost be physically sick beforehand
I never liked that er because it was too formal for me but just generally
I have no problem at all
no no no I've never had any problem talking in public either I've what was my first training was on the stage so I I did three years at drama school
and I mean performing is better to me than actually

doing anything else erm you know? much better than anything else really so erm so what do you see the future of this course are you going to be doing anything more or are you gonna keep this going in the same way?
well the way it's going here
this although it's an extraordinarily good building it's not big enough
and I I suppose as the the Brew House dropped away a bit
and I know it's still going
but this is sort of almost they've crossed over
and this is on the up I mean I know they've applied and have got a a an access course
running and er for next year so there is other possibilities where they could do sort of er FDAs and all sorts here
but but that would erm need some more accommodation which they've
possibly acquired this huge place opposite
yeah but that wouldn't be anything to do with me I've really I don't know I'm very much an integral part I just really got the thing off the ground
in terms of the visual arts that side of it
yeah I think we might stop cos the music's got so loud hasn't it? erm so wewe've done fifteen minutes so that's fine alright?
yeah yeah yeah that's erm I'll just check there er stop recording is that
